item.title: MP add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "Love her as in childhood Through feeble, old and grey. For you’ll never miss a mother’s love Till she’s buried beneath the clay." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: MP add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: MP add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear." -- Judy Blume

item.title: MP add a quote by Ken Follett
item.description: "To someone standing in the nave, looking down the length of the church toward the east, the round window would seem like a huge sun exploding into innumerable shards of gorgeous color." -- Ken Follett

item.title: MP add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: MP add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: MP add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MP add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: MP add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: MP add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: MP add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MP add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: MP add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: MP add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: MP add a quote by Frank McCourt
item.description: "If you were mean to your parents, they'd give you a good belt in the gob and send you flying across the room." -- Frank McCourt

item.title: MP add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: MP add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so lightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: MP add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it." -- W.C. Fields

item.title: MP add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Her lips on his could tell him better than all her stumbling words." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: MP add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: MP add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "We stand there, quiet. My questions all seem wrong: How did you get so old? Was it all at once, in a day, or did you peter out bit by bit? When did you stop having parties? Did everyone else get old too, or was it just you? Are other people still here, hiding in the palm trees or holding their breath underwater? When did you last swim your laps? Do your bones hurt? Did you know this was coming and hide that you knew, or did it ambush you from behind?" -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: MP add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "If I had a view like this to look down on every day, I would have the energy and inspiration to conquer the world. The trouble is, when you most need such a view, no one gives it to you." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: MP add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "The pause makes you think the song will end. And then the song isn't really over, so you're relieved. But then the song does actually end, because every song ends, obviously, and THAT. TIME. THE. END. IS. FOR. REAL." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: MP add a quote by Neale Donald Walsch
item.description: "Life begins at the end of your comfort zone." -- Neale Donald Walsch

item.title: MP add a quote by Neale Donald Walsch
item.description: "What's happening is merely what's happening. How you feel about it is another matter." -- Neale Donald Walsch
